p: In 2016, the 69th World Health Assembly adopted the Global Health Sector Strategy on Viral Hepatitis (GHSSH) 2016‚Äê2021. The strategy outlines five synergistic prevention and treatment service coverage targets to achieve the elimination of viral hepatitis as a public health threat by 2030 (defined as 90% reduction in incidence and 65% in mortality, see Table 1). 18 Implementation of the strategy is expected to strengthen health systems while enabling progress toward the United Nations' Sustainable Development Goal (SDG) 3 target of universal health coverage. 19, 20 Modelling studies suggest that rapid investment in diagnostic, prevention, and treatment services could achieve the World Health Organization (WHO) targets by 2030. 21, 22
